Crimes.Legal_Issue: Application of 'new evidence' under s. 113(a) of IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 113(a)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer questioned authenticity and timing of summons; assessed sufficiency and probity
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to present qualifying new evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Concerns about authenticity and credibility of summons
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Only new evidence arising after rejection or not reasonably available earlier may be submitted
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was observed in assessing new evidence
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Claimed error in legal interpretation of 'new evidence'
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Officer evaluated evidence but did not accept it as valid new evidence
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent Resident Applicant subject to inadmissibility
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Criminality related to failure to comply
